update.description:
Added test for proper removal of force/torque sensor plugins. Without the Joint::Fini() method it causes a segfault, while with the sensor removal added in the Joint::Fini() method it runs smoothly. 

The test has a fairly long waiting period hardcoded that I have copied from another model removal test ( #!/osrf/gazebo/src/default/test/integration/world.cc#cl-46 ) I guess that if this causes problem (the test takes too much time) it can be reduced or substituted by another check.
update.title: Add test for issue #1112

content.raw: very minor suggestion, use `++i` for consistency with gazebo's coding style
content.html: very minor suggestion, use ++i for consistency with gazebo's coding style

we could potentially reduce the waiting time by periodically checking the model count, e.g.

int sleepCount = 20;
int sleep = 0;
while (world->GetModelCount() > 0u && sleep < sleepCount)
{
  common::Time::MSleep(100);
  sleep++;
}
EXPECT_EQ(world->GetModelCount(), 0u);
Jenkins is also happy. Congrats.

content.raw: You're right, the `sh tools/code_check.sh` doesn't check the `test/plugins` folder but the bitbucket_pullrequests tool does. I'll make a separate pull request add test/plugins to the code_check search path.
content.html: You're right, the sh tools/code_check.sh doesn't check the test/plugins folder but the bitbucket_pullrequests tool does. I'll make a separate pull request add test/plugins to the code_check search path.

content.raw: Ok, I was running sh tools/code_check.sh, but for some reason it did not produce any notification related to ForceTorqueModelRemovalTestPlugin .
content.html: Ok, I was running sh tools/code_check.sh, but for some reason it did not produce any notification related to ForceTorqueModelRemovalTestPlugin .

content.raw:
We have a code_check script that runs cppcheck and cpplint according to the [gazebo style guide](http://gazebosim.org/user_guide/modifying__style.html). You can run it from the root of the gazebo folder with `sh tools/code_check.sh`. That checks all the code, which can take awhile, so we have another script for pull requests.

If you run:
~~~
$ tools/bitbucket_pullrequests -c 1028
~~~
it will run the code_check script against the changed files in this pull request. It registers about 40 errors for me (mostly whitespace and lines greater than 80 characters).
content.html:
We have a code_check script that runs cppcheck and cpplint according to the gazebo style guide. You can run it from the root of the gazebo folder with sh tools/code_check.sh. That checks all the code, which can take awhile, so we have another script for pull requests.

If you run:

$ tools/bitbucket_pullrequests -c 1028

it will run the code_check script against the changed files in this pull request. It registers about 40 errors for me (mostly whitespace and lines greater than 80 characters).

content.raw: We try to keep these lists alphabetized.
content.html: We try to keep these lists alphabetized.

content.raw:
Excellent! I just confirmed that this test fails without `Joint::Fini` and passes with `Joint::Fini`.

There are just a few minor style issues that I will add comments about. If you don't have time to address them, I will merge this pull request into branch issue_1112, fix them, and then submit a separate pull request targeted to gazebo_3.0.
content.html:
Excellent! I just confirmed that this test fails without Joint::Fini and passes with Joint::Fini.

There are just a few minor style issues that I will add comments about. If you don't have time to address them, I will merge this pull request into branch issue_1112, fix them, and then submit a separate pull request targeted to gazebo_3.0.
